summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorneys regarding the preparation and filing of a motion to seal documents in the Epstein case. The email discusses procedural steps for sealing filings, including general assertions about the confidentiality of negotiations and omitting Epstein's name from the motion.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email inquiring about sealing their declaration and coordinating filing procedures.

events.title: Preparation of Motion to Seal
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorneys prepare and coordinate the filing of a motion to seal documents related to the Epstein case, including a government response and a sealed document tracking sheet.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's office was preparing to file a motion to seal documents in the Epstein case on July 9, 2008.
The motion to seal was drafted to make general assertions about the confidentiality of negotiations and specifically omitted Jeffrey Epstein's name.
Procedural steps included preparing a sealed document tracking sheet and placing sealed documents in separate envelopes with the case number written on the outside.
